channel.title: Graphback Blog
channel.description: The best place to stay up-to-date with the latest Graphback news and events.

item.title: Graphback - Low Code, GraphQL based API suited for your needs
item.description:
NOTE: This blog post can be also viewed on medium: https://medium.com/@wtr/graphback-plugin-based-realtime-database-generator-78f4f608b81e

Graphback- Plugin based Realtime Database Generator

TL:DR -We have done extensive changes in Graphback over the last 3 weeks focused on refactoring to support custom plugins You can try it now at github.com/aerogear/graphback

item.title: Crash course on Graphback
item.description: Building software can be sometimes overwhelming. As junior developers, we are often looking for a sample application that can guide us thru complex server and client architectures. However, as a junior dev, we are often facing problems of templates being too complex or too simple, making the learning process more convoluted.

item.title: Graphback - the evolution of the GraphQL ecosystem
item.description: GraphQL was created almost 7 years ago at Facebook to resolve specific problems for the Facebook mobile platform. As Query Language, GraphQL offers transport and data exchange layer between server and client, leaving many implementation details to developers. When comparing with REST, GraphQL technology has a steep learning curve and many pitfalls waiting for beginner developers looking to embrace it.

item.title: Using Visitor Pattern to parse GraphQL AST
item.description: GraphQL is a amazing technology which is being adapted more and more. As part of my work for JBoss community in GSoC'19 I have been working on Graphback. For the needs of the project we had to extract information from a schema (SDL syntax) into a nice object we can use. For example, convert this
